title: Google\Cloud\Redis\V1\Instance
name: Instance
description:
A Memorystore for Redis instance.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.redis.v1.Instance

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.name
params.description: Required. Unique name of the resource in this scope including project and location using the form: projects/{project_id}/locations/{location_id}/instances/{instance_id} Note: Redis instances are managed and addressed at regional level so location_id here refers to a GCP region; however, users may choose which specific zone (or collection of zones for cross-zone instances) an instance should be provisioned in. Refer to [location_id][google.cloud.redis.v1.Instance.location_id] and [alternative_location_id][google.cloud.redis.v1.Instance.alternative_location_id] fields for more details.

params.name: data.display_name
params.description: An arbitrary and optional user-provided name for the instance.

params.name: data.labels
params.description: Resource labels to represent user provided metadata

params.name: data.location_id
params.description: Optional. The zone where the instance will be provisioned. If not provided, the service will choose a zone from the specified region for the instance. For standard tier, additional nodes will be added across multiple zones for protection against zonal failures. If specified, at least one node will be provisioned in this zone.

params.name: data.alternative_location_id
params.description: Optional. If specified, at least one node will be provisioned in this zone in addition to the zone specified in location_id. Only applicable to standard tier. If provided, it must be a different zone from the one provided in [location_id]. Additional nodes beyond the first 2 will be placed in zones selected by the service.

params.name: data.redis_version
params.description: Optional. The version of Redis software. If not provided, latest supported version will be used. Currently, the supported values are: REDIS_3_2 for Redis 3.2 compatibility REDIS_4_0 for Redis 4.0 compatibility (default) REDIS_5_0 for Redis 5.0 compatibility REDIS_6_X for Redis 6.x compatibility

params.name: data.reserved_ip_range
params.description: Optional. For DIRECT_PEERING mode, the CIDR range of internal addresses that are reserved for this instance. Range must be unique and non-overlapping with existing subnets in an authorized network. For PRIVATE_SERVICE_ACCESS mode, the name of one allocated IP address ranges associated with this private service access connection. If not provided, the service will choose an unused /29 block, for example, 10.0.0.0/29 or 192.168.0.0/29. For READ_REPLICAS_ENABLED the default block size is /28.

params.name: data.secondary_ip_range
params.description: Optional. Additional IP range for node placement. Required when enabling read replicas on an existing instance. For DIRECT_PEERING mode value must be a CIDR range of size /28, or "auto". For PRIVATE_SERVICE_ACCESS mode value must be the name of an allocated address range associated with the private service access connection, or "auto".

params.name: data.host
params.description: Output only. Hostname or IP address of the exposed Redis endpoint used by clients to connect to the service.

params.name: data.port
params.description: Output only. The port number of the exposed Redis endpoint.

params.name: data.current_location_id
params.description: Output only. The current zone where the Redis primary node is located. In basic tier, this will always be the same as [location_id]. In standard tier, this can be the zone of any node in the instance.

params.name: data.create_time
params.description: Output only. The time the instance was created.

params.name: data.state
params.description: Output only. The current state of this instance.

params.name: data.status_message
params.description: Output only. Additional information about the current status of this instance, if available.

params.name: data.redis_configs
params.description: Optional. Redis configuration parameters, according to http://redis.io/topics/config. Currently, the only supported parameters are: Redis version 3.2 and newer: maxmemory-policy notify-keyspace-events Redis version 4.0 and newer: activedefrag lfu-decay-time lfu-log-factor maxmemory-gb Redis version 5.0 and newer: stream-node-max-bytes stream-node-max-entries

params.name: data.tier
params.description: Required. The service tier of the instance.

params.name: data.memory_size_gb
params.description: Required. Redis memory size in GiB.

params.name: data.authorized_network
params.description: Optional. The full name of the Google Compute Engine network to which the instance is connected. If left unspecified, the default network will be used.

params.name: data.persistence_iam_identity
params.description: Output only. Cloud IAM identity used by import / export operations to transfer data to/from Cloud Storage. Format is "serviceAccount:". The value may change over time for a given instance so should be checked before each import/export operation.

params.name: data.connect_mode
params.description: Optional. The network connect mode of the Redis instance. If not provided, the connect mode defaults to DIRECT_PEERING.

params.name: data.auth_enabled
params.description: Optional. Indicates whether OSS Redis AUTH is enabled for the instance. If set to "true" AUTH is enabled on the instance. Default value is "false" meaning AUTH is disabled.

params.name: data.server_ca_certs
params.description: Output only. List of server CA certificates for the instance.

params.name: data.transit_encryption_mode
params.description: Optional. The TLS mode of the Redis instance. If not provided, TLS is disabled for the instance.

params.name: data.maintenance_policy
params.description: Optional. The maintenance policy for the instance. If not provided, maintenance events can be performed at any time.

params.name: data.maintenance_schedule
params.description: Output only. Date and time of upcoming maintenance events which have been scheduled.

params.name: data.replica_count
params.description: Optional. The number of replica nodes. The valid range for the Standard Tier with read replicas enabled is [1-5] and defaults to 2. If read replicas are not enabled for a Standard Tier instance, the only valid value is 1 and the default is 1. The valid value for basic tier is 0 and the default is also 0.

params.name: data.nodes
params.description: Output only. Info per node.

params.name: data.read_endpoint
params.description: Output only. Hostname or IP address of the exposed readonly Redis endpoint. Standard tier only. Targets all healthy replica nodes in instance. Replication is asynchronous and replica nodes will exhibit some lag behind the primary. Write requests must target 'host'.

params.name: data.read_endpoint_port
params.description: Output only. The port number of the exposed readonly redis endpoint. Standard tier only. Write requests should target 'port'.

params.name: data.read_replicas_mode
params.description: Optional. Read replicas mode for the instance. Defaults to READ_REPLICAS_DISABLED.

methods.name: getLocationId
methods.description:
Optional. The zone where the instance will be provisioned. If not provided, the service will choose a zone from the specified region for the instance.

For standard tier, additional nodes will be added across multiple zones for protection against zonal failures. If specified, at least one node will be provisioned in this zone.

  • REDIS_6_X for Redis 6.x compatibility

methods.name: getRedisConfigs
methods.description:
Optional. Redis configuration parameters, according to http://redis.io/topics/config. Currently, the only supported parameters are: Redis version 3.2 and newer:

  • maxmemory-policy
  • notify-keyspace-events Redis version 4.0 and newer:
  • activedefrag
  • lfu-decay-time
  • lfu-log-factor
  • maxmemory-gb Redis version 5.0 and newer:
  • stream-node-max-bytes
  • stream-node-max-entries

Generated from protobuf field map<string, string> redis_configs = 16 [(.google.api.field_behavior) = OPTIONAL];

methods.description:
Optional. The number of replica nodes. The valid range for the Standard Tier with read replicas enabled is [1-5] and defaults to 2. If read replicas are not enabled for a Standard Tier instance, the only valid value is 1 and the default is 1. The valid value for basic tier is 0 and the default is also 0.

Generated from protobuf field int32 replica_count = 31 [(.google.api.field_behavior) = OPTIONAL];

methods.name: getReadEndpoint
methods.description:
Output only. Hostname or IP address of the exposed readonly Redis endpoint. Standard tier only. Targets all healthy replica nodes in instance. Replication is asynchronous and replica nodes will exhibit some lag behind the primary. Write requests must target 'host'.

Generated from protobuf field string read_endpoint = 33 [(.google.api.field_behavior) = OUTPUT_ONLY];
